result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gia Maria Novak

Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km       to rg

9:49 AM 9:47 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: K. Edwards, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Gia Maria Novak in court.  Attorney Kevin Wade DeVore in court for Gia Maria Novak.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF463 (INIT) & 21CF841 (FPT). Court reviews file.  No agreement at this time, this matter will proceed to JT on the 28th of July.  Parties make statements regarding Jury Trial.  on 22CF463-  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading, this will be scheduled as STC with JT. bph
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.

- Includes 21CF841 & 22CF463

- Bond on file in case 21CF841

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center. I further understand that I am required to be equipped with a Remote Breath Test and submit to testing 3 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center/ Day Report Center by the end of the following business day.
